message.content:
{"id": "49299", 
"title": "Bug 49299: Incorrect behavior regarding custom cookie name and URL rewriting", 
"description": "Bug 49299: The documentation in Servlet 3.0 chapter 7.1.1 states that a custom cookie name should affect URL rewriting. However, the actual behavior is different. When a custom name is configured for session tracking cookies, the generated URI parameter still uses the default name 'jsessionid' instead of the custom name.", 
"OB": "In chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is mentioned that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name should also be used as the name of the URI parameter when the session ID is encoded in the URL, provided that URL rewriting is enabled.", 
"EB": "The actual result observed is that the page sends a cookie with the name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE', but the 'Reload' link on the page incorrectly uses the default name 'jsessionid' in the URL, instead of the expected custom name.", 
"SR": "There is a need to correct the behavior of the 'Reload' link to properly use the custom name of the session ID in the URL, as specified in the documentation."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '49299', 'title': 'Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting', 'description': 'Bug 49299Servlet 3.0 ch.7.1.1 says that custom cookie name affects URL rewriting ', 'OB': 'Created attachment 25442 [details]cookiename.warIn chapter 7.1.1 of servlet30finalspec.pdf it is said that"If a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, thesame custom name will also be used as the name of the URI parameter if the sessionid is encoded in the URL (provided that URL rewriting has been enabled). Actual result:The page sends the following cookie:SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnlybut the Reload link on the page uses "jsessionid":http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
